title: Sfiso Ncwane's son pens heartbreaking Valentine's message
text:
Sfiso Ncwane's son pens heartbreaking Valentine's message TshisaLIVE | 14 February, 2017 09:59 Ayanda Ncwane and Sfiso Ncwane.
Image by: Via Sfiso Ncwane's Instagram Sfiso Ncwane's young son Mawenza has paid an emotional tribute to his parents on Valentine's Day, reflecting on the heartbreak his dad's death has caused their mom. WATCH: What Trevor Noah thinks of the ANC leading SA SNAPS: Celebrity couples who serve Valentine's Day love envy In memes: How Date My Family's 'Ghetto snob' Lerato slayed the internet Mawenza shared a sorrowful picture of his mom at Sfiso's graveside along with an emotional Valentine's Day message.
A post shared by Mawenza Ncwane (@mawenzancwane) on Feb 13, 2017 at 9:13pm PST
In the post he reflected on his mother's pain and whether he and his older brother would ever be able to put a smile on her face again.
"I wonder if Ngcweti and I will ever able to put this kind of smile on mom's face. Even now she looks at dad with so much love. We are here mommy," Mawenza wrote.
WATCH: What Trevor Noah thinks of the ANC leading SA Ayanda opened up about her struggles to piece together her life in an Instagram post earlier this month. In the post she said that she had come close to throwing in the towel but would be strong.
She has also previously described how much she missed her husband. "I can still smell your perfume, feel your arms around me each morning. Only if there was a manual to walk this journey. Hmm.! But you said to us "Wethembekile Baba" i'll hold on to that my love," she wrote
The gospel singer died suddenly in December after being rushed to hospital for kidney related problems.
